required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Music During ESWL for Half Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Music Listening to Decrease Pain and Discomfort During Extracorporeal Shock Wave Lithotripsy (SWL): a Prospective Randomized Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate if music listening relieves pain and discomfort during Extracorporeal Shock-Waves Lithotripsy (ESWL).

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients undergoing ESWL and interested in music listening are randomly divided in two groups: patients in group A listen to music during the first part of the treatment (first 1800 SW), patients in group B during the second part.
At the end of the treatment patients are asked to fill in a questionnaire. They are asked if they were pleased to have had the opportunity to listen to music during ESWL, if they would like to listen to music again in case of further treatments, if they consider music helpful in relieving pain and discomfort during ESWL. Patients are also asked to mark their level of pain during each part of the treatment on a visual analogue scale (VAS) for pain.

primary_outcome.measure: percentage of patients who appreciated music listening during SWL without anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: patients were asked if they appreciated music listening during swl

secondary_outcome.measure: percentage of patients who considered music useful to relieve pain
secondary_outcome.description: patients were asked if they considered music useful to relieve pain during swl
Visual analogue scale (VAS) - 0 to 10, higher values, worse pain

secondary_outcome.measure: change on VAS scores separately measured in each part of the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analogue scale (VAS) - 0 to 10, higher values, worse pain

arm_group.arm_group_label: Music during the first part of ESWL
arm_group.description: Patients listen to music during the first part of ESWL treatment (first 1800 SW).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Music during the second part of ESWL
arm_group.description: Patients listen to music during the second part of ESWL treatment.

intervention.intervention_name: Music during the first part of ESWL
intervention.description: Music listening during first part of ESWL
intervention.arm_group_label: Music during the first part of ESWL

intervention.arm_group_label: Music during the second part of ESWL

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients undergoing ESWL from February 2011 to October 2012 and interested in music listening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to ESWL
- No interest in music listening
- < 18 years and > 80 years
